name: Carbon Black Response
description: This app supports executing various endpoint-based investigative and containment actions on Carbon Black Response

actions.description: Validate the asset configuration by attempting to connect. This action runs a quick query on the device to check the connection and credentials

Hunt for a binary file on the network by querying for the MD5 hash of it on the Carbon Black Response device. This utilizes Carbon Black Response's binary search feature to look for files on the hard drives of endpoints
actions.verbose:
This action gives back paginated results. The 'range' parameter can be used to control the number and indexes of the search results.
This action requires only a Carbon Black Response api_token. The Carbon Black Response user assigned to that token does not require any privileges (i.e. No Access).

hash.description: MD5 of the binary or process to hunt

range.description: Range of items to return, for e.g. 0-10

actions.description: Create an alert/watchlist
actions.verbose:
Carbon Black Response supports 'watchlists' which are customized alerts that search for a binary or running process on an endpoint that matches a certain query. See the carbonblack_app playbook for examples.
This action requires only a Carbon Black Response api_token. The Carbon Black Response user assigned to that token does not require any privileges (i.e. No Access)

query.description: Query to add the watchlist for

actions.description: Run a search query on the device
actions.verbose: This action requires only a Carbon Black Response api_token. The Carbon Black Response user assigned to that token does not require any privileges (i.e. No Access).

query.description: Query to run (Carbon Black Response search language)

range.description: Range of items to return, for e.g. 0-10

example_values: Symantec Class 3 SHA256 Code Signing CA

actions.description: List all the alerts/watchlists configured on the device
actions.verbose: This action requires only a Carbon Black Response api_token. The Carbon Black Response user assigned to that token does not require any privileges (i.e. No Access).

actions.description: List all the endpoints/sensors configured on the device
actions.verbose: This action requires Carbon Black Response view privileges to list sensors and therefore a list of endpoints known to Carbon Black Response. If this privilege is not assigned to the asset api_token, the action will succeed and return an empty list.

example_values: Windows Server 2008 R2 Server Enterprise Service Pack 1, 64-bit

actions.description: Quarantine the endpoint
actions.verbose:
Carbon Black Response can have multiple entries that match an ip address, even a host name. This could happen if a machine was removed and re-added to Carbon Black Response after an extended period of time. Carbon Black Response also supports partial matches for host names, for e.g. if ip_hostname is specified as WIN then this will match endpoints with host name WINXP and WIN8. The action will return an error if multiple online endpoints match the input parameter.
This action requires administrative privileges to search for the given endpoints and set the quarantine/isolation state. If this privilege is not assigned to the asset api_token, the action may return an empty list or HTTP 405 Method Not Allowed error.

example_values: Quarantine action succeeded. It might take some time for endpoint to get isolated.

actions.description: Unquarantine the endpoint
actions.verbose:
Carbon Black Response can have multiple entries that match an ip address, even a host name. This could happen if a machine was removed and re-added to Carbon Black Response after an extended period of time. Carbon Black Response also supports partial matches for host names, for e.g. if ip_hostname is specified as WIN then this will match endpoints with host name WINXP and WIN8. The action will return an error if multiple online endpoints match the input parameter.
This action requires administrative privileges to search for the given endpoints and re-set the quarantine/isolation state. If this privilege is not assigned to the asset api_token, the action may return an empty list or HTTP 405 Method Not Allowed error.

example_values: Unquarantine action succeeded. It might take some time for endpoint to take effect.

actions.description: Force a sensor to sync all queued events to the server
actions.verbose:
Force the specified sensor to synchronize all queued events that have been observed on the endpoint but have not yet been uploaded to the server and made searchable. This may generate a significant amount of network traffic because it overrides the default behavior that rate-limits the RabbitMQ messages to conserve bandwidth. As specified by the Carbon Black Response API, this flush is implemented by writing a future date to the sensor's event_log_flush_time. In this case, the current time plus one day is used because that is how it is done in the official Python API (https://github.com/carbonblack/cbapi-python).
If sensor_id is specified, ip_hostname will be ignored.

ip_hostname.description: Hostname/IP address to sync events for

sensor_id.description: Carbon Black sensor id to sync events for

actions.description: Get information about an endpoint
actions.verbose:
This action requires Carbon Black Response view privileges to list sensors and therefore a list of endpoints known to Carbon Black Response. If this privilege is not assigned to the asset api_token, the action will succeed and return an empty list.
If sensor_id is specified, other input parameters will be ignored.

ip_hostname.description: Hostname/IP address to get info of

actions.description: List the running processes on a machine
actions.verbose:
If sensor_id is specified, other input parameters will be ignored (and removed from the resultant parameter dictionary), else the App searches for endpoints that match the value specified in ip_hostname. Carbon Black Response can have multiple entries that match an ip address, even a host name. This could happen if a machine was removed and re-added to Carbon Black Response after an extended period of time. Carbon Black Response also supports partial matches for host names, for e.g. if ip_hostname is specified as WIN then this will match endpoints with host name WINXP and WIN8 and in this case, the action will try to get the process list for all the matching endpoints.
This action requires Carbon Black Response administrative privileges. If this privilege is not assigned to the asset api_token, the action may return an empty list or HTTP 405 Method Not Allowed error.

ip_hostname.description: Name/IP of the machine to list processes on

actions.description: Kill running processes on a machine
actions.verbose:
If sensor_id is specified, other input parameters will be ignored (and removed from the resultant parameter dictionary), else the App searches for endpoints that match the value specified in ip_hostname. Carbon Black Response can have multiple entries that match an ip address, even a host name. This could happen if a machine was removed and re-added to Carbon Black Response after an extended period of time. Carbon Black Response also supports partial matches for host names, for e.g. if ip_hostname is specified as WIN then this will match endpoints with host name WINXP and WIN8. If the input host name matches more than one ONLINE endpoint the action will treat this as an error.
This action requires Carbon Black Response administrative privileges. If this privilege is not assigned to the asset api_token, the action may return an empty list or HTTP 405 Method Not Allowed error.

ip_hostname.description: Name/IP of the machine to terminate process on

actions.description: Download a file from Carbon Black Response and add it to the vault
actions.verbose:
To get a file from a source, provide a sensor_id, file_source, optional offset, and optional get_count. Otherwise, provide a hash, which also tries to get file information from the Carbon Black Response server if available. If hash is provided, all the other input parameters will be ignored.
A file that shows up in the results of the hunt file action might still not be available for download in case the endpoint sensor is not connected to the server. This action requires only a Carbon Black Response api_token. The Carbon Black Response user assigned to that token does not require any privileges (i.e. No Access).

sensor_id.description: Carbon Black sensor id to sync events for. Required for getting file from source

offset.description: When source is defined, set the byte offset to start getting the file. Supports a partial get. Optional for getting file from source

get_count.description: When source is defined, set the number of bytes to grab. Optional for getting file from source

example_values:
File type: pe file
Vault id: 08f57fd06bbd8063d5b828521654225952a8155e
Name: wmiprvse.exe
Cb url: https://192.168.0.245/#/binary/75E683BC8284D99F998500162BE4CFE2
File type: pe file, Vault id: 41c4e1e9abe08b218f5ea60d8ae41a5f523e7534, Name: ping.exe, Cb url: https://10.1.16.170/#/binary/5FB30FE90736C7FC77DE637021B1CE7C

actions.description: Upload file to a Windows hostname

vault_id.description: Vault id of file to upload

destination.description: Destination path of the file (ie: C:\Windows\CarbonBlack\MyFolder)

sensor_id.description: Carbon Black sensor id to sync events for

actions.description: Issue a Carbon Black Response command by providing the command name and the command's parameters as the 'data'

sensor_id.description: Carbon Black sensor id to sync events for

data.description: JSON formatted body. Refer to Carbon Black REST API for command parameters

actions.description: Execute a process

sensor_id.description: Carbon Black sensor id to sync events for

entire_executable_path.description: Path and command line of the executable

output_file.description: File that STDERR and STDOUT will be redirected to

working_directory.description: The working directory of the executable

wait.description: Wait for the process to complete execution before reporting the result

actions.description: Memory dump for a specified path

sensor_id.description: Carbon Black sensor id to sync events for

destination_path.description: Path on endpoint to save the resulting memory dump (ie: C:\Windows\CarbonBlack\Folder)

actions.description: Tell the server to reset the sensor "sensor_wait_timeout"
Get info about a file from Carbon Black Response
actions.verbose: This action requires only a Carbon Black Response api_token. The Carbon Black Response user assigned to that token does not require any privileges (i.e. No Access).

hash.description: MD5 of file/sample to get info of

example_values:
Os type: Windows
Size: 489984
Architecture: 64 bit
Name: Wmiprvse.exe
Cb url: https://192.168.0.245/#/binary/75E683BC8284D99F998500162BE4CFE2
Os type: Windows, Size: 27136, Architecture: 64 bit, Name: svchost.exe, Cb url: https://10.1.16.170/#/binary/c78655bc80301d76ed4fef1c1ea40a7d
Os type: Windows, Size: 366512, Architecture: 64 bit, Name: NisSrv.exe, Cb url: https://10.1.16.170/#/binary/9bf50324444c46997c2492d505b47f2d

actions.description: Add a hash to the Carbon Black Response blacklist
actions.verbose: This action requires Carbon Black Response administrative privileges. If this privilege is not assigned to the asset api_token, the action may return an empty list or HTTP 405 Method Not Allowed error.

example_values: Block hash action succeeded. It might take some time for blacklisting to take effect.

actions.description: Unblock the hash
actions.verbose: This action requires Carbon Black Response administrative privileges. If this privilege is not assigned to the asset api_token, the action may return an empty list or HTTP 405 Method Not Allowed error.

example_values: Unblock hash action succeeded. It might take some time for unblocking to take effect.

actions.description: List all of the connections from a given process name, PID, or Carbon Black process ID
actions.verbose: If either a process name or PID is provided, then a hostname must be provided as well. If a PID is provided, the process name parameter will be ignored. If a Carbon Black process ID is given, all of the other parameters will be ignored. The Carbon Black process ID refers to internal ID which Carbon Black Response assigns to every process. It can be found in the action result of hunt file in action_result.data.*.process.results.*.id or in the output of this action.

carbonblack_process_id.description: Internal Carbon Black ID of process

actions.description: Ingests unresolved alerts into Phantom

start_time.description: Start of the time range, in epoch time (milliseconds). If not specified, the default is the past_days setting of the App

end_time.description: End of the time range, in epoch time (milliseconds). If not specified, the default is now

container_count.description: Maximum number of container records to query for.

artifact_count.description: Maximum number of artifact records to query for.

actions.description: Gets the license information of the device

example_values:
-- --- BEGIN CB LICENSE REQUEST --- --

-- --- END CB LICENSE REQUEST --- --
-- --- BEGIN CB LICENSE REQUEST --- --

-- --- END CB LICENSE REQUEST --- --
